revised_title: Conservation of Microsatellite Loci in Fish Species: Implications for Evolutionary Relationships
tldr: This study investigates the conservation of microsatellite loci among fish species, using primers from 18 microsatellite loci in 14 different fish species. The research demonstrates that flanking sequences for microsatellite motifs are highly conserved over a span of 470 million years, suggesting that these sequences may play an important role in eukaryotic genomes and are under strong selective constraints. The findings indicate that heterologous primers can be a valuable source of polymorphic markers among fish species, but caution should be used when comparing variability across species.
